troubleshooting.title: Error Parsing CSS File - Caused by a Networking Problem

indexterm.product: author developer editor authorEclipse developerEclipse editorEclipse
author developer editor authorEclipse developerEclipse editorEclipse
author developer editor authorEclipse developerEclipse editorEclipse

condition.title: Problem
condition.p: My custom styles are not applied and in the transformation results console, I get an error containing one of the following: I/O exception, Unknown host, Error parsing.

cause.title: Cause
cause.p:
One of the CSS files contains references to resources from another website that is currently inaccessible. These resources may include:
Fonts
Images
Other CSS files If you exported one of the built-in publishing templates from the transformation scenario dialog, it is possible that the associated CSS files use an imported Google Font.

step.cmd: Check your proxy settings (ask the system administrator for help).

If the server is still inaccessible from the transformation process, download the remote resources using a web browser, save them in the customization CSS file folder, and refer them directly from your CSS.

info.note: If the problem is caused by a remote font, see Using Local Fonts.
